measured_by: Suspiciousness condition of the Minnesota Trust Game
justification: "The 'Suspiciousness' condition, unique to the MTG, can be modeled to isolate spite sensitivity, suggesting that spite sensitivity is separate from inequity aversion or risk aversion."
"We isolated the estimation of partner's spite-guilt… The estimated spite-guilt parameter correlated with self-reported suspiciousness," indicating the parameter operationalises spite sensitivity.
"The Alienation subscale quantifies suspiciousness in day-to-day life and contains items such as 'some people are against me for no good reason.'"

measured_by: Risk Aversion coin conditions of the Minnesota Trust Game
justification: "Participants also play this game against a fair coin… thus the conditions against the coin are referred to as Risk Aversion," linking those task trials to the construct.
The authors "anticipated [the] Harm Avoidance [subscale] would be associated with risk aversion," showing it is used as a questionnaire measure of that construct.

measured_by: First Mover choices in the Minnesota Trust Game
justification: In the MTG, "the first mover's shift from trusting the second mover to not trusting… reveals their level of rational mistrust," so the first-mover decision serves as the behavioural measure of trust.
